TEXT.TITLE: FRANCE PLANS TIGHTER SHAREHOLDING DISCLOSURE LEVELS
TEXT.BODY: The French government plans new legislation this year which will lower the thresholds at which investors in companies must declare their shareholdings, Bourse officials said. The new rules, part of a scheme to provide more openness in corporate ownership structure, will lower the initial declaration threshold to five pct of a company's capital. Under current rules, an investor has to notify the Bourse supervisory commission when a holding exceeds 10 pct, and again at 33 pct and 50 pct. The officials said a 20 pct level has also been added to the scale. Reuter
